questions.question: 1. Which cell is responsible for bone matrix maintenance?

7. Bone formation is carried out by:

options: Non-vascular membrane lining the bone marrow cavity
Non-vascular membrane lining the outer surface of bone
Vascular membrane lining the bone marrow cavity, internal surface
Vascular membrane lining the outer surface of bone

options: Outer and inner layer of skull
Outer covering of cartilage and vertebrae

options: Outer and inner layer of skull
Outer covering of cartilage and vertebrae

questions.question: 16. In compact bone, Volkmann canals are lined with osteoblasts and contain bone vessels.
17. The organic matter of bone matrix contains calcium and phosphorus.
18. Osteoclasts originate between lamellae.
19. Osteoclasts are responsible for bone formation.
20. Osteocytes are responsible for the maintenance of bone matrix.
21. The organic matter of bone matrix contains collagen and proteoglycan.
22. Osteoclasts originate from blood monocytes.
23. Osteoclasts have basophilic cytoplasm.
24. Osteocytes contain many ribosomes and Golgi apparatus.
25. Osteocytes contain many microtubules.
26. Alkaline phosphatase enzyme removes calcium.
27. The periosteum covers the inner surface of bone and the bone marrow cavity.
28. The endosteum consists of two layers: an outer fibrous layer and an inner osteogenic layer.
29. The endosteum contains Sharpey's fibers.
30. The outer covering of cartilage and ribs is compact bone.
31. Growing bone has four zones.
32. The proliferation zone is characterized by large chondrocytes with cytoplasm rich in glycogen.
33. The endosteum consists of a single layer of osteoprogenitor cells.
34. The center layer of the skull is composed of compact bone.
35. The shaft of a long bone is composed of compact bone.
36. The epiphysis is composed of cancellous bone.
